title: What shouldn't I think when writing an essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: The short answer would be – anything that isn’t related to your topic or the writing process. Your task here is to focus on the assignment and never let any trivial thoughts get into. If you want to read something more specific, here it is: Time. Don’t count hours before the deadline expires. Yes, you lack time, but you don’t have to get panic-stricken. If you do, you’ll find it impossible to concentrate and fail to write an essay that complies with the academic demands.If you don’t know who your target readers are, don’t think as if they know the subject perfectly. If there are complex terms, ensure to explain them.Don’t think your essay text is flawless once you’re done with it. Check it. Check it again. Recheck it. Perfect has to limits.Don’t think that your tutor is not going to notice “that tiny error.” Use plagiarism software, grammar, and punctuation checkers to make sure the text is errorless.Best luck with your writing!
